chem package¶

Submodules¶

chem.ions module¶

chem.ions.chemical_properties()[source]¶

A database function which contains chemical values

chem.ions.meq(array)[source]¶

Convert from milligrams per litre to milli-equivilents per litre.

Args:

Parameters:array – A one dimensional array or two dimensional pandas dataframe containing in mg/L in the order of ‘Ca’, ‘Mg’, ‘Na’, ‘K’, ‘HCO3’, ‘CO3’, ‘Cl’, ‘SO4’
Returns:The input array in meq/L
chem.ions.schoeller(array, labels=None, show=True, save=False, fname=None, figsize=(4, 6), cmap='tab20')[source]¶

Create a Schoeller diagram.

Args:

Parameters:
  • array – A one dimensional array or pandas dataframe containing in meq/L in the order of ‘Ca’, ‘Mg’, ‘Na’, ‘K’, ‘HCO3’, ‘CO3’, ‘Cl’, ‘SO4’
  • labels – If a pandas datframe include labels for each row as an array.
  • show – If True shows plot else returns plot object.
  • Save – save the plot default is False
  • fname – filename default is none
  • figsize – figure size tuple default (4, 6)
  • cmap – the colourmap default is “tab 20”
Returns:

A schoeller digram of the data

chem.piper module¶

chem.piper.piper(dat_piper, alphalevel=1, color=True, save=False, fname=None, figsize=(4, 4))[source]¶

Create a Piper plot using the code by Peeters, (2014).

Args:

Parameters:
  • dat_piper – [nx8] matrix, chemical analysis in mg/L order: Ca Mg Na K HCO3 CO3 Cl SO4
  • alphalevel – transparency level of points. If 1, points are opaque
  • color – boolean, use background coloring of Piper plot default True
  • save – Save or not default not
  • figsize – tuple figure size (default (4, 4))
Returns:

piperplot

Code from https://github.com/inkenbrandt/Peeters_Piper/blob/master/peeter_piper.py:

Citation:

@article {GWAT:GWAT12118, author = {Peeters, Luk}, title = {A Background Color Scheme for Piper Plots to Spatially Visualize Hydrochemical Patterns}, journal = {Groundwater}, volume = {52}, number = {1}, publisher = {Blackwell Publishing Ltd}, issn = {1745-6584}, url = {http://dx.doi.org/10.1111/gwat.12118}, doi = {10.1111/gwat.12118}, pages = {2–6}, year = {2014}, }
